title: Gochujang chilli scallops in lettuce cups

ingredients.item: 4 salad onions, trimmed and finely sliced
¼ cucumber, peeled and seeds removed
½ x 128g pack Cooks’ Ingredients Tempura Batter

instructions.step: Whisk together the gochujang chilli paste in a bowl with the rice wine vinegar and sesame oil.

Take each little gem and peel off the 4 largest leaves and reserve. From the rest of the lettuce hearts, remove the stem, shred the remaining lettuce and put into a bowl along with the salad onion. Peel the cucumber and cut the flesh into small 1cm chunks. Add to the bowl with the shredded lettuce and salad onions.
Pour the gochujang dressing over the salad mixture and toss well to coat all the ingredients. Leave to marinate.
Heat about 12cm of oil in a deep pan

to 180°C. In a bowl, whisk together the tempura batter and the sparkling water until you get a smooth batter. Drop a few scallops at a time into the bowl to coat in the batter mixture, then deep fry for about 2 minutes until cooked through and the flesh is white (and the batter crisp and golden). Remove from the pan and place on a piece of kitchen roll to remove excess oil. Repeat the process with the remaining scallops and batter until all have been fried.
When ready to serve, spoon the dressed, shredded salad into the 8 large reserved leaves, top with the fried scallops and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
